title: Classic Department Store Memories
description: Remember the magic of department store shopping? Test your memories of the great stores that defined American retail!

questions.question: Which New York City department store hosted the famous Thanksgiving Day Parade starting in 1924?
questions.explanation: Macy's has hosted its iconic Thanksgiving Day Parade since 1924, making it one of America's most beloved holiday traditions.

questions.question: Which department store chain was known for its 'Satisfaction Guaranteed or Your Money Back' return policy?
questions.explanation: Sears, Roebuck & Co. built its reputation on the guarantee of 'Satisfaction Guaranteed or Your Money Back,' earning customer trust for decades.

questions.question: What department store feature allowed customers to sit and test perfumes and cosmetics while a salesperson helped them?
questions.explanation: The cosmetics counter was a highlight of department store shopping, where elegantly dressed saleswomen would help customers try perfumes and makeup.

questions.question: Which upscale department store was known for its elegant Christmas window displays on Fifth Avenue in New York?
questions.explanation: Saks Fifth Avenue became famous for its spectacular holiday window displays on Fifth Avenue, which drew crowds of admirers every Christmas season.

questions.question: What did the pneumatic tube system in department stores do before computerized registers?
options: Send cash and receipts to a central cashier
questions.explanation: Pneumatic tube systems whisked small cylinders containing cash and sales slips to a central cashier station, where change was made and sent back to the sales floor.

questions.question: Which department store was famous for its 'Wish Book' Christmas catalog that children pored over each holiday season?
questions.explanation: The Sears 'Wish Book' Christmas catalog was a beloved tradition where children would spend hours circling toys and gifts they hoped to receive.

questions.question: What special feature did many department stores have where shoppers could sit down and enjoy a meal during their visit?
questions.explanation: Department store tea rooms and restaurants were elegant dining experiences where ladies who lunched could enjoy a meal between shopping on different floors.

questions.question: Which Chicago department store, on State Street, was famous for its Walnut Room restaurant and elaborate Christmas tree?
questions.explanation: Marshall Field's on State Street was a Chicago institution, famous for its Walnut Room restaurant and the magnificent Great Tree displayed there every Christmas.

questions.question: What department store employee operated the elevator and announced each floor's departments to shoppers?
questions.explanation: Elevator operators were a fixture of department stores, manually operating the elevator and calling out 'Going up!' along with each floor's departments.

questions.question: Which Texas-based luxury department store was known for its outrageous 'His and Hers' Christmas gifts in its catalog?
questions.explanation: Neiman Marcus became famous for its extravagant 'His and Hers' fantasy gifts in its Christmas catalog, including items like matching airplanes.

questions.question: What was the name for the department store service where a knowledgeable salesperson helped you select clothing and accessories?
questions.explanation: Personal shopping services, offered by upscale department stores, provided dedicated salespeople who knew your taste and would pull selections for you.

questions.question: Which beloved five-and-dime chain had lunch counters where you could order a grilled cheese and a milkshake?
questions.explanation: Woolworth's lunch counters were a beloved American institution, serving affordable meals like grilled cheese sandwiches and milkshakes at long counter seats.

questions.question: What special store feature allowed women to have their newly purchased dresses and suits tailored to fit perfectly?
questions.explanation: Department stores had alterations departments with skilled tailors and seamstresses who would adjust hems, take in waists, and ensure a perfect fit.

questions.question: What type of metal token did some department stores give customers instead of coins as change in the mid-20th century?
questions.explanation: Charge coins (or charge plates) were small metal identification tokens issued by department stores, predating modern credit cards for establishing store accounts.

questions.question: Which department store rivalry was famously featured in the 1947 movie 'Miracle on 34th Street'?
questions.explanation: The movie 'Miracle on 34th Street' centered on Macy's and its rivalry with Gimbels, two competing department stores in New York City.
